dataset_info.name: Oil Well Drilling Cost Prediction
dataset_info.description: Predict total drilling cost for oil wells based on geological conditions, drilling parameters, and operational factors
dataset_info.target_description: Total cost of drilling operation in USD
dataset_info.use_case: Budget planning, project feasibility analysis, cost optimization, and financial risk assessment

data_dictionary.planned_depth_ft: Planned total drilling depth in feet
data_dictionary.rig_day_rate_usd: Daily rig rental cost in USD
data_dictionary.mud_cost_per_bbl: Drilling mud cost per barrel in USD
data_dictionary.casing_steel_cost_per_ft: Casing steel cost per foot in USD
data_dictionary.total_drilling_cost_usd: Target: Total drilling cost in USD

cost_optimization_factors: Good location accessibility reduces logistics costs
Simple geology reduces equipment and time needs

business_applications.project_budgeting: Accurate cost estimation for drilling projects
business_applications.portfolio_optimization: Compare costs across multiple drilling prospects

preprocessing_notes.outlier_handling: Monitor for extremely high/low cost wells
preprocessing_notes.feature_engineering: Consider cost per foot, complexity×depth interactions
preprocessing_notes.log_transformation: Consider log-transforming target for better distribution

usage_example.python_code:
import json
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, RobustScaler
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error, mean_squared_error

# Load data
with open('drilling_cost_regression.json', 'r') as f:
    dataset = json.load(f)

# Convert to DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(dataset['data'])

# Feature engineering
df['cost_per_foot'] = df['total_drilling_cost_usd'] / df['planned_depth_ft']
df['complexity_depth_interaction'] = df['geological_complexity_score'] * df['planned_depth_ft']

# Separate features and target
features = dataset['features'] + ['complexity_depth_interaction']
X = df[features]
y = df['total_drilling_cost_usd']

# Log transform target for better distribution
y_log = np.log(y)

# Scale features
scaler = RobustScaler()  # Better for outliers
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X)

# Train-test split
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X_scaled, y_log, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)
usage_example.model_architecture: Input(11) → Dense(256, ReLU) → Dropout(0.3) → Dense(128, ReLU) → Dropout(0.2) → Dense(64, ReLU) → Dense(1, Linear)
usage_example.metrics: MAE, RMSE, MAPE (Mean Absolute Percentage Error), R-squared
usage_example.prediction_postprocessing: Apply exponential function to convert log predictions back to original scale

financial_insights.cost_benchmarking: Compare actual vs predicted costs for performance evaluation
financial_insights.budget_variance_analysis: Identify which factors cause largest cost deviations
financial_insights.scenario_planning: Model costs under different geological/operational scenarios
financial_insights.contract_optimization: Optimize rig contracts based on predicted drilling duration
financial_insights.investment_decisions: Support go/no-go decisions for drilling projects

model_validation.cross_validation: Use time-series split if data has temporal component
model_validation.residual_analysis: Check for patterns in prediction errors
model_validation.sensitivity_analysis: Understand how cost changes with parameter variations
model_validation.business_validation: Validate predictions with drilling engineers and project managers
